column1: #Text=[0083] The rolling motion has a good washing ability and a low vibration level, with minimized laundry damage and low motor load.
#Text=As a result, the rolling motion may be used in all of the washing courses, especially, to aid detergent dissolution in an initial washing stage and to wet the laundry.
#Text=[0084] The tumbling motion has a lower washing ability than the scrub motion and a middle vibration level in comparison to the scrub motion and the rolling motion.
#Text=The rolling motion has a lower vibration level but it has a longer washing time than the tumbling motion.
#Text=Because of that, the tumbling motion may be applicable to all of the washing courses and may be effective in a washing course to distribute the laundry uniformly.
#Text=[0085] The squeeze motion has a similar washing ability to the tumbling motion and a higher vibration level than the tumbling motion.
#Text=The squeeze motion repeats the process of drawing the laundry toward and separating the laundry from the inner circumferential surface of the drum.
#Text=In this process, the wash water is discharged outside of the drum after passing through the laundry.
#Text=Thus, the squeeze motion may be applied to rinsing.
#Text=[0086] The filtration motion has a lower washing ability than the squeeze motion and a similar noise level to the rolling motion.
#Text=In the filtration motion, the water passes through the laundry and is discharged out of the drum, with the laundry in close contact with the inner circumferential surface of the drum.
#Text=As a result, the filtration motion may be applied to a course for wetting of the laundry.

#Text=[0087] The swing motion has the lowest vibration level and washing ability and may be applied in a low noise and low vibration washing course and a course for washing sensitive or delicate articles.
